results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lilias Fraser
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Lilias Fraser

results.title: Robert Redford
results.creator_credit: Ray Atherton and Passport International Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood remembers”.
Robert Redford has enjoyed a successful career spanning decades as an actor, producer and director. Using rare production stills, coming attraction trailers and behind the scenes footage, this informative video provides an historical account of his screen career and an insight into his personal life.

results.title: Robert Rauschenberg: man at work
results.creator_credit: Chris Granlund, Guggenheim Productions, RM Arts and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Robert Rauschenberg, one of the most important artists of the twentieth century. life works and practice are featured in this documentary. Influenced mostly by popular culture and the everyday his practice has continued for over 40 years being one of the most influential artists of his time. His retrospective at the Guggenheim, New York in 1997 is featured as well as his 1/4 Mile or 2 Furlong Piece, a multipanelled autobiographical piece begun in 1982 that is expected to out measure the length of its title once completed. Living and working since the 70’s in his Captiva island studio off Florida, Rauschenberg constructs 1/4 Mile, demonstrating his process whilst giving us an opportunity to see the piece for the first time in its entirety. Narrated by Sean Barrett.

results.title: Robert Penn Warren
results.creator_credit: Educational Television and Radio Center and Dynamic Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers of today”.
A re-release of a ‘50s interview with American novelist, playwright and poet, Robert Penn Warren (“All the King’s Men”). It was originally recorded for the Educational Television and Radio Center as part of a series, hosted by Walter Kerr, New York Herald Tribune drama critic, on the role of the writer as thinker and creative artist. Penn Warren discusses the value of teaching creative writing, the “germ” of an idea that “fires up” the writer, the sense of place and recurrent themes in his writing.

results.title: Robert Motherwell and the New York school
results.creator_credit: Catherine Tatge, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Thirteen and International Cultural Programming
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Robert Motherwell was the leading figure in the Abstract Expressionist movement in New York in the 1940’s and was to revolutionise the face of American painting. Made shortly before his death in 1991 this is director Tatge’s elegy to Motherwell, the vanguard of American modernism. Along with Arshille Gorky, William Bazeodis, Hans Hoffman, Franz Kline, William de Kooning, Barnett Newman, Jackson Pollock, Mark Rothko and David Smith, Motherwell made up what is known as “The New York school”. The journey or search in their work as artists was to make art in the U.S. that was equal to that in Europe. Within a hostile political environment and known historically as the most hated of all the art movements, the Abstract Expressionists had achieved this by the early 1950’s. With archival footage and interviews this documentary paints an inspirational portrait of a man and movement in one of the most volatile times in modern history. Juxtaposed throughout is footage of Motherwell preparing for his retrospective at the Guggenheim Museum in New York.

results.title: Robert Mapplethorpe
results.brief_description: Mapplethorpe’s studies of nude black men were a shameless affirmation of gay sexuality. He has been credited with helping to formulate a sense of gay identity in New York, but as one of the most successful photographers of modern time, his work has also been instrumental in restoring the male nude to mainstream art. This program charts Mapplethorpe’s career from student to leading figure in the art world.
results.description: Mapplethorpe’s studies of nude black men were a shameless affirmation of gay sexuality. This program charts Mapplethorpe’s career from student to leading figure in the art world.
